definition: To publicly support or suggest an idea
example: The group does not advocate the use of violence.

definition: Based on observation or experience rather than theory
example: There is no empirical evidence to support his thesis.

definition: Having or expressing more than one possible meaning
example: The wording of the agreement is ambiguous.

definition: A system in which people or things are arranged according to their importance
example: She worked her way up the corporate hierarchy.

definition: To change, especially continuously and between one level or thing and another
example: Vegetable prices fluctuate according to the season.

definition: Existing very commonly or happening often
example: These diseases are more prevalent among young children.

definition: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty
example: The new building has little aesthetic value.

definition: The chemical processes that occur within a living organism in order to maintain life
example: Exercise can speed up your metabolism.

definition: Originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native
example: The indigenous people of the region were displaced.

definition: Matter that settles to the bottom of a liquid
example: There was a thick layer of sediment at the bottom of the bottle.

definition: Something that causes activity between two or more persons or forces without itself being affected
example: The protest acted as a catalyst for change.

definition: In its original condition; unspoiled
example: The car is in pristine condition.

definition: Connected with thinking or conscious mental processes
example: Some of her cognitive functions have been impaired.

definition: Happening after something else
example: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation.

definition: Possible to do easily or conveniently
example: It is not feasible to monitor such a large area.

definition: Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected
example: There are a number of anomalies in the present system.

definition: To make less severe, serious, or painful
example: Drainage schemes have helped to mitigate this problem.

definition: To examine or inspect closely and thoroughly
example: Customers were warned to scrutinize the small print.

definition: To spread or cause to spread over a wide area or among a large number of people
example: The problem is how to diffuse power without creating anarchy.

definition: Very old or old-fashioned
example: Prisons are run on archaic methods.

definition: A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence
example: Several hypotheses for global warming have been suggested.

definition: Capable of working successfully; feasible
example: The proposed investment was economically viable.

definition: Not easily convinced; having doubts or reservations
example: Many experts remain skeptical about his claims.

definition: To help to clarify or explain
example: This article illuminates the basic principles of economics.

definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model
example: There is a new paradigm for production in the film industry.

definition: To combine (a number of things) into a coherent whole
example: Pupils should synthesize the data they have gathered.

definition: To come before (something) in time
example: A gun battle had preceded the explosions.

definition: About to happen
example: They were in imminent danger of being swept away.

definition: The process of eroding or being eroded by wind, water, or other natural agents
example: The problem of soil erosion is serious.

definition: The action or process of innovating
example: Technological innovation is changing the industry.
